messages: b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:03): Did we already have a discussion about the confusion that will arise when authors try to do document.createElement("svg") and expect it to work?
467f6d43402c6573237052cefcc252db (22:05): yes, we decided it was not worth the complexity of making it work
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:06): the right solution for now is probably to have js libraries to paper over the confusingness
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:09): Right I don't really see how you woulf make it work in general
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:09): All I can imagine is having createSVGElement and so on
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:09): Which would mean that you didn't have to remember the namespace at least
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:09): doug had an idea of Element.createElement
467f6d43402c6573237052cefcc252db (22:09): the SVG WG has some plan on adding a bunch of constructors I believe
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:10): which would use the same namespace as the element you're calling it on
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:10): Interesting
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:10): I guess that might help
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:11): doesn't help if you want to create a new <svg> root in an html document
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:12): I guess javascript libraries can just have tagname->namspace mappings
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:12): which will almost-always work
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:13): i think we should wait and see how js libraries solve this before extending dom core
467f6d43402c6573237052cefcc252db (22:13): I sort of doubt they'll solve this on the element-level
467f6d43402c6573237052cefcc252db (22:14): JS libraries that create SVG today have more high-level functionality
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:15): if authors don't feel the need to solve it on the element level, we shouldn't extend dom core to solve it
